website_summaries.verdict: User-friendly features and a value-friendly price make this chinois strainer the best pick for cooks who need fine mesh for their straining needs and want to save a few dollars.
pros: Sports a rounded handle that's comfortable to hold and easy to grip while you work
Also has a hole so you can hang it for storage
Fine mesh is housed in a stainless steel frame
Works well for capturing most tiny pieces
cons: Occasional damage to the strainer upon delivery has been reported

customer_reviews.title: Rust and breaches in mesh
customer_reviews.text: This chinois showed up with rust and multiple noticable gaps in the mesh. Not worth what they are charging for this sup par equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Zackmakesfood

customer_reviews.title: Spend more money to get a better product
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had spent more for one of greater quality both in terms of materials (it's tinny) and it's design to fit -- it hobbles and has to be held in place which is not easy when straining a big batch of anything.
customer_reviews.author: v

customer_reviews.title: This thing looked beat up when it arrived. I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing looked beat up when it arrived. I'm sure it would strain as well as any but it does not sit level when placed on top of a pot because of the placement of the hook on the one end and the fat handle. Not well designed.
customer_reviews.author: suason

customer_reviews.title: Can cut your hands on the handle
customer_reviews.text: The handle is not a tube, but metal bent round in shape and *only welded in three spots (spot/tack welded); in the remaining area, the metal meets metal and a very small gap, on which you can cut your hands. I returned upon arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Howard

customer_reviews.title: It does NOT come with a stand and I can’t find one!
customer_reviews.text: It does a great job straining my chalk paint, however; when it comes time to clean it, because the mesh is so fine, it’s tough to get into the tiny holes. I’m not sure if it can be used to filter paint but when I bought the chalk paint it said that customers also bought this product when buying chalk paint. What I am most annoyed at is that it did not come with a stand and now that I am looking for the stand, not only do I not see one being offered, now I see that I could have bought the one that comes not only with a stand but with a pestle as well! ARGH!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ana Derector

customer_reviews.title: Can’t hold without cutting fingers.
customer_reviews.text: I threw this out. The handle is dangerous. 2 pieces of metal that don’t quit meet. If you move your hand while holding it you risk slicing you hand on the razor sharp joint. I couldn’t bend the joints to match and had to wear oven mitts using this. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Janderson

customer_reviews.title: serves its purpose, but the one we got was ...
customer_reviews.text: serves its purpose, but the one we got was not new and shiny looking as pictured. it was dingy and had water spots in a few places, even though it was still in packaging. in all fairness, we could have sent it back, but we didn't because we needed it.
customer_reviews.author: graeme newman

customer_reviews.title: An excellent chinois
customer_reviews.text: Not all of these things sold are real chinois, many glorified strainers. This is the real thing. The extra fine mesh is great for things like applesauce. I bought a stand for it and that is wonderful. Seems very durable and well made. I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: MadMax

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and good quality
customer_reviews.text: sturdy and good quality. The mesh is not as close knit as one might hope, but one would need to pay $30-$60 more for a truly fine mesh chinois. Im very happy and would recommend it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Pike

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I used it to filter bone ingredients to make broth. It works very well and easy to clean. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Tri G. Tu

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Strainer - Very Poor Handle
customer_reviews.text: Strainer is very good. The handle is made with thin stainless. It has a sharp edge.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D.

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: Does the job well enough. I wish it would stand on its own -- I usually just drain the stock into tupperware, and it would be really nice if I could just put the strainer over the tupperware, and not have to hold the handle.
customer_reviews.author: jonnyhal

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: Solid, well built and a perfect fine mesh that is easily lined with filters or cheese cloth. Good for professional kitchens but small enough for home use (can be washed in a standard residential sink).
customer_reviews.author: Tim Post

customer_reviews.title: Very fine
customer_reviews.text: Commercial quality. I bought it to strain home made stock. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Filter
customer_reviews.text: I used it to filter Quinoa before cooking. I'm sure I'll find plenty of other uses while cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Carl N. Graves

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I use this to strain vodka infusions. It is better than the ones we had. The only issue is it is hard to clean when you have super small seeds from blueberries.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: I've used other fine mesh strainers
customer_reviews.text: I've used other fine mesh strainers, but always had some pulp get through. Not with this one! It strains everything out and only the liquid comes through. So good I bought another for my sister. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effie huge
customer_reviews.text: This guy is way bigger than I needed it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Juanman Juanjar

customer_reviews.title: Chinois
customer_reviews.text: The chinois arrived as promised. We used it within a day of arrival and it performed as we wanted. The resulting food was smooth and velvety as we expected. Clean-up was easy and the dishwasher did all of the work.
customer_reviews.author: Bill F

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: very handy to have in your kitchen, and much easier to work with.
customer_reviews.author: leep38

customer_reviews.title: I need a replacement after the one I had for ...
customer_reviews.text: I need a replacement after the one I had for some 40 years was accidentally used to make mud pies with a garden trowel. Ouch.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfhound Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make my own Greek yogurt. It strains the whey from my homemade yogurt. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda de los Santos

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean. Good size.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to srtain my vegetable stock. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Enna

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget
customer_reviews.text: Works great Love kitchen gadgets Nice having right tool for the job
customer_reviews.author: chad patton

customer_reviews.title: I love it. It was a little larger than I ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It was a little larger than I thought it would be but it still worked perfectly to keep the crud from the used oil getting through the strainer
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Love the fine mesh holes to make smooth hot sauce.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy l sankey

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sweet.
customer_reviews.text: I need more. Fits perfectly into 2 and 4 gt round cambros.
customer_reviews.author: TylerWKessler

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: It looks great. The mesh screen seems very fine to stop particles. Haven't used it yet. Was delivered over night. Whats not to like.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Geiser

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy  large
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift to my son who is a Chef.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: a must have in a good
customer_reviews.text: any and everything strainer, a must have in a good kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Moore

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Upon receipt of the item one of the metal bars for structural integrity had been popped loose. Really poor welding and overall quality. Incredibly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Ernest

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product
customer_reviews.text: Really glad I spent the extra money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: phillip cummings

customer_reviews.title: It's a good chinois
customer_reviews.text: Great chinois, big, sturdy, and easy to handle. My stocks and sauces have never been clearer.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Mainguy

customer_reviews.title: Very well made, high quality chinois. Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I've never used a chinois before but I needed something to strain herbs from oil after infusing to use in making lotion. This is a fabulous tool. The screen is very fine so almost all the herbs stay inside it. I wrap fine cheesecloth around the outside, secure with a rubber band and very little plant material goes into the cheesecloth. It's very well made, all stainless steel, is pretty easy to clean (I use a soapy brush & all the little bits come right off). This is a quality product & a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Luce

customer_reviews.title: High marks
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a chef and gave it high marks
customer_reviews.author: Jon S.

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The pictures show a stand and a mortor. I received neither. I hate deception.
customer_reviews.author: BILL LOHMAN

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Solid product for home use. It's fine enough to wash quinoa.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very solidly made and easy to clean. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for large pots only
customer_reviews.text: A very large commercial type unit that works fine. The mesh is very small which makes it great for filtering almost anything completely. My problem is the design. It will not stand on it's own, and is way too large for anything but my largest pot. It's very well made, and if I ever need to strain stock for 25 people, it will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Riverguy

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for a decent chinois for the price
customer_reviews.text: If you're a chef, you'll immediately recognize this as a chinois. It's exactly like a commercial model, aside from the fact it feels a bit flimsier. Same dimensions, same mesh, similar construction. I think for home use, and if you don't abuse it like you might a commercial version, it should last a good long time. Only complaint is that the mesh narrows to a point to small for for a 2oz ladle. So, a 1oz ladle will be needed to help thoroughly push thickets foods through.
customer_reviews.author: MacFlagg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this strainer to make bone broth, which apparently is a good thing to drink when you're fasting (to replace salt and many other nutrients) and even when you're not. The strainer is solidly constructed from stainless steel, has no imperfections that I can see, works well, and is reasonably priced. (Goodness, I can buy THREE of these AND a pestle for the price of one Matfer strainer.) I'll edit this review if the strainer ever rusts, but right now I have only good things to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Prewitt

customer_reviews.title: Fine mesh indeed and did the trick - a bit large for most?
customer_reviews.text: Needed one of these to strain a fancy soup and it worked really well. Probably the hardest part was finding a pan or bowl the rest this massive thing in. Ended up holding it the whole time rather than making use of the clasp end.....I even tried my KitchenAid mixing bowl and it wasn't deep enough. Oh well, I had 15 cups to do and the larger size worked well. It's well crafted and it will last forever.....just consider sizes better than I did.....if this is what you need, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Greenwell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be good quality, I've been draining yogurt, and it works well for that.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Eases the strain of straining stock!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy to have bought this product. Having used strainers while working in a restaurant they are very convenient to use and make your life much simpler. Having been making a lot of stocks at home I wanted to buy one to cut down on the hassle of removing the bones and veg from my stock. This thing works wonders and is fine enough to help remove a lot of little impurities when straining my stocks. Not the largest size but it is respectable, and I can strain about 4 quarts worth of stock in 2 tries with this strainer. Well built and quality piece of equipment, will be able to handle some abuse without fear of breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Jackson

customer_reviews.title: good press for removing seeds when canning
customer_reviews.text: The mesh on this is very fine so you have to work quite hard if you have thick pulp, this would also make a great strainer for making broths and clear soups as it is very fine. Purchase with the wooden pestle which won't damage the device unless you use the pestle as a hammer. it has a tab on the end so it will hold itself up in a deep pan or bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Warped mesh
customer_reviews.text: Seems very durable, but the mesh arrived all warped and there is really no way of straightening it out. It's not simply dented, the whole thing is all lumpy. Really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Foodservice 38071 Chinois Mesh Strainer
customer_reviews.text: This item came exceedingly dented, but since I already had a large pot of tomatoes cooking I attempted to use it. The pestal I purchased that was supposed to be for this strainer DID NOT fit and I would up with a mess trying to strain the tomatoes. This is a horrible pair to use for straining.
customer_reviews.author: jacquej

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: Product is as described. Works well for my intended use of separating infusedoil and butter from plant material.
customer_reviews.author: snoogums

customer_reviews.title: Parts sold as fitting together don't
customer_reviews.text: The strainer (chinois), stand, and pestle are all good quality at a good price. But there were sold as working together. The stand is too small, and works marginally. The pestle is too large and works poorly. I emailed back and forth about three times, with photos and my own drawings, and they were not interested in approving a return.
customer_reviews.author: aaron snyder

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Use it to strain yogurt. Works okay for that if you have a system to hold it upright when you put it in a pot to collect the whey. Construction seems to be good have used it 4 times with no issues. Arrived on time and in good condition
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This gets the job done well, easily, and it's easy to clean. There is no splash -- probably because of the construction of the mesh. It would be nice if it would stand up by itself, but that's a small price to pay for a tool that works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: ANNE107

customer_reviews.title: Great for straining yogurt and cheese
customer_reviews.text: This works great! I use it for straining yogurt and homemade cheese. It also works great for sifting things like flour when you're baking and for straining a sauce.
customer_reviews.author: Jerbear

customer_reviews.title: Great tool at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for the price. When I cooked professionally, these indispensable devices ran us $150-200. I will treat it with great care, unlike a real kitchen, and expect it will last a lifetime. Clean immediately after use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Ton

customer_reviews.title: Top Grade Commercial Quality
customer_reviews.text: The openings are very small and tight. It is large (see the mesuraments.) It can be hang on pots, so you can have both hands free to pour. The back draw is the device is not too easy to clean. I have been using a sponge, but maybe I need to use a brush instead.
customer_reviews.author: M. Maier

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't take out too much of the puree but also gets out any grit and makes for a super smooth puree
customer_reviews.text: I use this to strain baby food purees and it works just right. Doesn't take out too much of the puree but also gets out any grit and makes for a super smooth puree.
customer_reviews.author: Player_One

customer_reviews.title: Great strainer use it daily with no issues
customer_reviews.text: Great strainer use it daily with no issues. Nice sturdy build easy to clean and a great price i would recommend, in use in high volume restaurant that takes a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Rizo71

customer_reviews.title: All of the Qualities of a good Chinois
customer_reviews.text: Great Chinois, the nice sturdy cage around it makes it easy to set on the bottom of bowl or pot. Durable, definitely worth the money to pick up.
customer_reviews.author: Hale

customer_reviews.title: FINE Sieve/Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a FINE sieve at an outstanding price. Super thrilled with this purchase. I've used it to sieve soup and homemade hazelnut milk. Works great. Good quality, too. Cleans well in dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: made4home

customer_reviews.title: Small mesh
customer_reviews.text: Great strainer. I make lots of broth and this strains very well.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie S. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a good buy! High quality and great for a clear and smooth sauce
customer_reviews.author: Cong

customer_reviews.title: Good for straining broth
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for arranging bone broth. No harder to clean than any other strainer. Quite durable. Very tall. Recommend highly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine mesh
customer_reviews.text: Like 40% cheaper than the restaurant supply. And it's identical
customer_reviews.author: thrifty shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good straining
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift for the cook in the family. He requested this and uses it often
customer_reviews.author: Golden girls

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: This made making jelly spool much easier than the way my grandma taught me!!! Love using her recipe, but with out the mess that cheese cloth makes. Much faster and I got more juice from the berries!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: As described and arrived very quickly!
customer_reviews.text: Not that easy to clean at the bottom but I guess that’s a problem with this type of strainer.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Nice size and well made
customer_reviews.text: A lot larger than expected, perfect for straining cheese. Well made and appears very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Old Mesquite Workshop

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tomato sauce
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for tomato sauce, removing lumps from sauces and catching left over tiny bones and herbs from home made soups.
customer_reviews.author: sim

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sturdy product. Great for making fine custards and soups.
customer_reviews.author: UpStateNYGuy

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This chinois work perfectly! I use it to strain homemade almond milk. It gets all the little bits out and is super easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous7

customer_reviews.title: Looks sturdy and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift. Looks sturdy and heavy for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Chavez

customer_reviews.title: strainer
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made and works great. Bought this mostly for straining ice cream and very glad I did. No more cheese cloth!
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good, large volume filter
customer_reviews.text: It holds a large volume and does a good job of filtering.
customer_reviews.author: Fisherperson

customer_reviews.title: Keeping healthy
customer_reviews.text: This has become my go to tool for my love of fresh fruit, popsicles and cocktails. My sister uses it for her vegetable soups.
customer_reviews.author: St John

customer_reviews.title: Well made - professional quality.
customer_reviews.text: High quality, good price - I am particularly happy that it stands up.
customer_reviews.author: Noel S.

customer_reviews.title: Very well made product. The price is absolutely right ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well made product. The price is absolutely right. I use this tool often as I work as a pro chef and so far it's been holding up very well. No need to hand wash, I have run it through my industrial dish sanitizer machine no problems.
customer_reviews.author: oneladyeagle

customer_reviews.title: Get this tool! Better than any kitchen work arounds we've tried!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stainless steel and sturdy kitchen tool. We use it for straining everything from hearty soup stocks/ bone broths to refined sauces. Can't believe we've been "getting by" with a bulky strainer all these years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just as fine a mesh as the pro version
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Chinois! It is just as fine a mesh as the ones we use in the professional kitchens at a fraction of the price. If you are looking for a Chinois get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as wanted
customer_reviews.text: Nice fine mesh but handle so big and heavy it won't stand on its own while you pour and scrape.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineMom

product_meta.title: New Star Foodservice 38071 Stainless Steel Reinforced Bouillon Strainer, 8-Inch
product_meta.description: Prepare soups and stocks, strain out seeds, stems and skins from fruits or vegetable to make your own jams and jellies, applesauce or babyfood, or it can also double as a colander for rinsing fruits or pasta. A great tool for any kitchen.
feature_bullets: Extra fine mesh separates solids and larger ingredients from soft foods and liquids
Perfect for stocks, sauces, and purees

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars265 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
